channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Warren Buffett is buying up stock in this high-margin internet registry company
item.description: Warren Buffett has spent more than $70 million over six days to Dec. 24 to resume buying VeriSign’s stock.

item.title: Warren Buffett stocks for your IRA in 2025
item.description: These picks look even more interesting than Berkshire Hathaway

item.title: Oil prices rise as Israeli strikes against Yemen’s Houthis triggers ‘fear bid’
item.description: Oil prices climbed on Friday as Israeli strikes against Yemen’s Houthi rebels triggered what one strategist described as a “fear bid” for the commodit...

item.title: Apple’s stock could have tough January, after this rare streak of gains
item.description: History suggests investors should be “cautious” on Apple’s stock heading into January following its recent streak of weekly gains.

item.title: Gold Futures Set for Weekly Loss Amid Thin Holiday Trading
item.description: Gold futures fell and were on track for weekly losses amid thin holiday trading. The precious metal has slid against stronger U.S. Treasury yields, wi...

item.title: Stocks Slip in Morning Trading
item.description: Major indexes, which had barely budged Thursday, remained on track to finish the Christmas week higher—and are closing in on strong full-year gains.

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Futures Mixed
item.description: Natural gas futures were mixed as the weekly reduction in U.S. inventories came in slightly smaller than expected.

item.title: Here’s how Trump can avoid a ’MAGA Civil War’ over immigration
item.description: The Republican Party will have unified control of Washington starting next month, but fissures in the party’s coalition are already emerging even befo...

item.title: Fallen Crypto Tycoon Do Kwon to Be Extradited to U.S.
item.description: Montenegro justice minister orders Kwon sent to U.S. rather than South Korea.

item.title: Year-End Flows Indicate Some Dollar Selling; Euro, Sterling Could Edge Up
item.description: Moves in currencies, especially in the euro and sterling against the dollar, suggest investors are tending to sell the dollar at year-end, Jefferies s...
